bibl.title: Notes on Arsinoe I: A Study of a Shadowy Queen.
bibl.note: This contribution, part of an ongoing preliminary study of early-Hellenistic marital practices and dynastic relations, developed from a personal correspondence with Chris Bennett and in general is a response to his notes on the subject published online and in print. - Arsinoe's Early Life. - The Marriage to Ptolemy II. - The Return of Arsinoe II. - The Wife of the Legitimate Scion. - Arsinoe's Removal from Alexandria. - Arsinoe in Cyrene? - The Children of Arsinoe I. - Conclusion. - Postscript.
bibl.seg: Branko van Oppen, Notes on Arsinoe I: A Study of a Shadowy Queen.

This contribution, part of an ongoing preliminary study of early-Hellenistic marital practices and dynastic relations, developed from a personal correspondence with Chris Bennett and in general is a response to his notes on the subject published online and in print. - Arsinoe's Early Life. - The Marriage to Ptolemy II. - The Return of Arsinoe II. - The Wife of the Legitimate Scion. - Arsinoe's Removal from Alexandria. - Arsinoe in Cyrene? - The Children of Arsinoe I. - Conclusion. - Postscript.
